Package ch.epfl.biop.operetta

Class OperettaManager

java.lang.Object
ch.epfl.biop.operetta.OperettaManager
public class OperettaManager extends Object
Operetta Manager class This class handles all the Operetta logic to extract data

The entry point is to call the OperettaManager.Builder class to create the correct OperettaManager object

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    OperettaManager.Builder
    This Builder class handles creating OperettaManager objects for you

  • Method Details

    • createReader

      public static IFormatReader createReader(String id) throws IOException, FormatException
      Initializes the reader for this series and makes sure to use Memoization
      Parameters:
      id - the String path to the xml file
      Returns:
      a BioFormats Reader with memoization
      Throws:
      IOException - an error while reading the data
      FormatException - and error regarding the data's format

    • getNormMin

      public double getNormMin()
      returns the minimum value to use for the normalization of images, in case you have 32-bit (digital phase contrast) images in this Operetta Database
      Returns:
      the minimum value for normalization

    • getNormMax

      public double getNormMax()
      returns the maximum value to use for the normalization of images, in case you have 32-bit (digital phase contrast) images in this Operetta Database
      Returns:
      the maximum value for normalization

    • getReader

      public IFormatReader getReader()
      Returns the reader used to extract metadata from the Operetta Format You could use this in order to access Bioformat's reader options
      Returns:
      a reader that is initialized to your dataset

    • getMetadata

      public IMetadata getMetadata()
      Returns the IMetadata object which we can use to access all information from the Experiment
      Returns:
      this Experiment's metadata

    • getAvailableWells

      public List<ome.xml.model.Well> getAvailableWells()
      Returns the list of all Wells in the Experiment This is currently configured to work only with one plate, but this method could be extended to work with Experiments containing multiple plates.
      Returns:
      a List of wells

    • getWell

      public ome.xml.model.Well getWell(int row, int column)
      convenience method to recover the well associated to a given row and column (0 indexed for both)
      Parameters:
      row - the row (0 indexed) of the well
      column - the column (0 indexed) of the well
      Returns:
      the well that matches the provided Row, Column indexes

    • getAvailableFieldIds

      public List<Integer> getAvailableFieldIds()
      Returns a list of Field Ids (Integers) for the Experiment. We cannot return a list of Fields (WellSamples in Bioformats slang) because these are unique to each Well. The Ids, however, are the same between all Well.
      Returns:
      a list of Ids that corresponds to all available fields per well

    • getAvailableFields

      public List<ome.xml.model.WellSample> getAvailableFields(ome.xml.model.Well well)
      For a given well, what are all the fields WellSample contained within
      Parameters:
      well - the selected well
      Returns:
      a list of Fields (WellSamples)

    • getField

      public ome.xml.model.WellSample getField(ome.xml.model.Well well, int field_id)
      Get the Field (WellSample) corresponding to the provided field_id in the given well
      Parameters:
      well - the well to query
      field_id - the id of the field
      Returns:
      the field corresponding to the ID

    • getFinalWellImageName

      public String getFinalWellImageName(ome.xml.model.Well well)
      Convenience method to get the final name of a well based on all the user parameters passed Useful for when the fields in a well are stitched together
      Parameters:
      well - the well to get the name from
      Returns:
      the name of the well image to use

      Returns:

    • getFinalFieldImageName

      public String getFinalFieldImageName(ome.xml.model.WellSample field)
      Returns a usable image name that reflects the field that was selected
      Parameters:
      field - the field (WellSample) to get the name from, this contains the well information directly
      Returns:
      the name of the image related to this Field (in a specific well

    • getWellImage

      public ImagePlus getWellImage(ome.xml.model.Well well)
      Overloaded method, for simplification See getWellImage(Well, List, int, HyperRange, Roi) for a complete breakdown
      Parameters:
      well - The well to export. All fields will be stitched
      Returns:
      the resulting ImagePlus ( C,Z,T Hyperstack ), calibrated

    • getWellImage

      public ImagePlus getWellImage(ome.xml.model.Well well, int downscale)
      Overloaded method, for simplification See getWellImage(Well, List, int, HyperRange, Roi) for a complete breakdown
      Parameters:
      well - The well to export. All fields will be stitched
      downscale - the downscale factor
      Returns:
      the resulting ImagePlus ( C,Z,T Hyperstack ), calibrated

    • getWellImage

      public ImagePlus getWellImage(ome.xml.model.Well well, int downscale, Roi subregion)
      Overloaded method, for simplification See getWellImage(Well, List, int, HyperRange, Roi) for a complete breakdown
      Parameters:
      well - The well to export. All fields will be stitched
      downscale - the downscale factor
      subregion - a square ROI to extract
      Returns:
      the resulting ImagePlus ( C,Z,T Hyperstack ), calibrated

    • getWellImage

      public ImagePlus getWellImage(ome.xml.model.Well well, int downscale, HyperRange range, Roi subregion)
      Overloaded method, for simplification See getWellImage(Well, List, int, HyperRange, Roi) for a complete breakdown
      Parameters:
      well - The well to export. All fields will be stitched
      downscale - the downscale factor
      range - the C Z T range to extract, as a HyperRange
      subregion - a square ROI to extract
      Returns:
      the resulting ImagePlus ( C,Z,T Hyperstack ), calibrated

    • getWellImage

      public ImagePlus getWellImage(ome.xml.model.Well well, List<ome.xml.model.WellSample> fields, int downscale, HyperRange range, Roi subregion)
      Exports the current well for the selected samples at the selected C Z T coordinates and for the given subregion into an ImagePlus
      Parameters:
      well - The well to export. All fields will be stitched
      fields - the fields to export
      downscale - the downscale factor
      range - the C Z T range to extract, as a HyperRange
      subregion - a square ROI to extract
      Returns:
      a calibrated ImagePlus

    • getFieldImage

      public ImagePlus getFieldImage(ome.xml.model.WellSample field)
      Exports the current field as an ImagePlus
      Parameters:
      field - the Field to export, get is through the metadata getMetadata()
      Returns:
      a calibrated ImagePlus

      public ImagePlus getFieldImage(ome.xml.model.WellSample field, int downscale)

    • readSingleStack

      public ImageStack readSingleStack(ome.xml.model.WellSample field, int downscale, HyperRange range, Roi subregion)
      Method to read a single stack from a field
      Parameters:
      field - the field to export
      downscale - the downscale factor
      range - the range in C Z T to use
      subregion - an optional subregion roi, set to null for none
      Returns:
      an ImageStack

    • process

      public void process(int downscale, Roi region, boolean is_fields_individual)
      this method tries to simplify the processing for a full export
      Parameters:
      downscale - the downscale factor
      region - an optional Roi to export, set to null for whole image
      is_fields_individual - export each field individually or as a stitched well

    • process

      public void process(List<ome.xml.model.Well> wells, List<Integer> fields, int downscale, Roi region, boolean is_fields_individual)
      this method tries to simplify the processing for a full export
      Parameters:
      wells - all the Wells to process as a list
      fields - all the Field IDs to process, as a list, set to null to process all
      downscale - the downscale factor
      region - an optional Roi to export, set to null for whole image
      is_fields_individual - export each field individually or as a stitched well

    • getIOBytes

      public long[] getIOBytes(List<ome.xml.model.Well> wells, List<Integer> fields, int downscale, boolean is_fields_individual)
      TODO : fix estimation of output bytes - check if this is correct
      Parameters:
      wells - all the Wells to process as a list
      fields - all the Field IDs to process, as a list, set to null to process all
      downscale - the downscale factor
      is_fields_individual - export each field individually or as a stitched well
      Returns:
      array of bytes that will be read from the dataset and written to the export folder when calling process(List, List, int, Roi, boolean)

    • getIODimensions

      public long[] getIODimensions(int downscale)
      Returns all dimensions for the data that we wish to export for size and time estimations
      Parameters:
      downscale - an eventual downscale factor
      Returns:
      an array with the full dataset sizes(sX, sY, sZ, sC, sT) and selected or downscaled sizes (sXOut, sYOut, sZOut, sCOut, sTOut)

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • writeWellPositionsFile

      public void writeWellPositionsFile(List<ome.xml.model.WellSample> samples, File position_file, int downscale) throws IOException
      writeWellPositionsFile can write the coordinates of the selected individually saved wells to a file to use with Plugins > Stitching > Grid/Collection Stitching...
      Parameters:
      samples - the list of samples (Fields) that will be written to the positions file
      position_file - the filename of where the position file will be written
      downscale - the downscale with which to adjust the coordinates
      Throws:
      IOException - error in case of problem working with the positions file

    • getIntersectingFields

      public List<ome.xml.model.WellSample> getIntersectingFields(List<ome.xml.model.WellSample> fields, Roi bounds)
      Finds fields related to the bounds that were given, to limit the number of files to export
      Parameters:
      fields - the fileds to check intersections in
      bounds - the roi for which we are looking for the intersecting fields
      Returns:
      a List of fields (WellSample s) that intersect with the given Roi

    • getFieldAdjustedCoordinates

      public Point getFieldAdjustedCoordinates(ome.xml.model.WellSample field, Roi bounds, Roi subregion, Point topleft, int downscale)
      Returns the final coordinates of a field based on all given arguments.
      Parameters:
      field - the field (WellSample)
      bounds - a roi, null if none
      subregion - a subroi
      topleft - the top left coordinate point
      downscale - the downsample factor
      Returns:
      the new coordinate for the given Field

    • getTopLeftCoordinates

      public Point getTopLeftCoordinates(List<ome.xml.model.WellSample> fields)
      Returns the top left coordinates as a point
      Parameters:
      fields - the fields we should get the coordinates for
      Returns:
      a point with the xy pixel coordinates

    • getTopLeftCoordinatesUm

      public Point getTopLeftCoordinatesUm(List<ome.xml.model.WellSample> fields)
      Returns the top left coordinates as a point
      Parameters:
      fields - the fields we should get the coordinates for
      Returns:
      a point with the xy pixel coordinates

      Returns:

      public Calibration getCalibration()
      Get the image calibration from the OMEXML Metadata
      Returns:
